cab.content: secret.P.(56) 2441 9th October, 1956CABINETRENT RESTRICTIONMemorandum by the Minister of housing and Local GovernmentOn 8th October the Cabinet agreed that a slice of the highervalued houses should be released from rent control at once(CM.(56) 60th Conclusions, Minute 5).2. The Committee of Ministers on the Rest Restriction Actshave considered this matter and recommend that the houses to bedecontrolled, in the forthcoming Rent Bill, should be those whoserateable value is over 40 in the Metropolitan Area and over 30 elsewhere in England and Wales. This would have the effect of releasing about -fmillion houses.3. I invite my colleagues to approve this recommendation.D.S.COPY NO.Ministry of Housing andLocal Government, S.W.I.19th October, 1056
